a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(x - 2) * (x + 2) * (x powr 2 + 4) = x powr 4 - 16"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $(x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4)$. The final Answer is x^4-16
 ### Proof
 We see that \begin{align} (x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4) &= (x^2-4)(x^2+4) \\ &= \boxed{x^4-16} \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(x - 2) * (x + 2) * (x powr 2 + 4) = x powr 4 - 16"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Prove that the product of $(x - 2)$, $(x + 2)$, and $(x^2 + 4)$ equals $x^4 - 16$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x - 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x powr 2 + 4"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. S x = P x * Q x * R x"
shows  "\<forall> x. S x = x powr 4 - 16"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $(x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4)$. The final Answer is x^4-16
 ### Proof
 We see that \begin{align} (x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4) &= (x^2-4)(x^2+4) \\ &= \boxed{x^4-16} \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x - 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x powr 2 + 4"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. S x = P x * Q x * R x"
shows  "\<forall> x. S x = x powr 4 - 16"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given the functions $P(x) = x - 2$, $Q(x) = x + 2$, $R(x) = x^2 + 4$, and $S(x) = P(x) \cdot Q(x) \cdot R(x)$, show that for all $x$, $S(x) = x^4 - 16$.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x - 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x powr 2 + 4"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. S x = x powr 4 - 16"
shows  "S x = (P x) * (Q x) * (R x)"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $(x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4)$. The final Answer is x^4-16
 ### Proof
 We see that \begin{align} (x-2)(x+2)(x^2+4) &= (x^2-4)(x^2+4) \\ &= \boxed{x^4-16} \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x - 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x powr 2 + 4"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. S x = x powr 4 - 16"
shows  "S x = (P x) * (Q x) * (R x)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given the functions $P(x) = x - 2$, $Q(x) = x + 2$, $R(x) = x^2 + 4$, and $S(x) = x^4 - 16$, prove that $S(x) = P(x) \cdot Q(x) \cdot R(x)$.
